titleInfo.title: Crayon print of James Coleman Adkins and wife Harriet E. Burnett Adkins

mods.abstract: James Coleman Adkins served in Co. H, 38th Va. Inf. Regt., CSA. According to his pension application he was wounded at Antietam, Md. in September 1862 and again at Gettysburg, Penn. in July 1863. The 38th Va. lost 55% of the men engaged at Gettysburg.; In 1867, James Coleman Adkins married Harriet E. Burnett and soon thereafter moved to Palmersville, Weakley County, Tennessee. Harriet died sometime before 1903 and James died in 1919. Both are buried in the Thompson Cemetery in Weakley County, Tennessee.

titleInfo.title: Looking Back: The Civil War in Tennessee

relatedItem.abstract: To commemorate the 150th anniversary of the Civil War (2011-2015), the Tennessee State Library and Archives is sending teams of archivists and conservators to communities across Tennessee. Individuals may schedule an appointment, and we will digitally copy and assist in the preservation of your Civil War era manuscripts, artifacts and photographs. Digital copies of these items, representing the rich Civil War heritage of Tennessee families, will become part of a virtual exhibit commemorating the 150th anniversary of the war in Tennessee....

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Record has been transformed into MODS 3.5 from a qualified Dublin Core record by the Digital Library of Tennessee, a service hub of the Digital Public Library of America, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/utkdigitalinitiatives/DLTN.
